intro: Polygala guantanamana subsp. alternifolia, commonly known as the Guantánamo polygala, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, usually green or yellowish flowers that are clustered in spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
